Description: Papyrus fragment bearing four lines of a Coptic text written against the fibres (verso). Some of the papyrus fibres are twisted. EA 75325, 75324, 75323, 75322, 75321 are mounted together.
Curator's comments: Provenance: the place of origin is a monastery of Apa Apollo for which the acquisition details suggest a Hermopolite context.
Bibliographic references: Clackson 2000 / Coptic and Greek Texts relating to the Hermopolite Monastery of Apa Apollo (p.12, 106-7, pl.25)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (86592) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/86592)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Monastery of Apa Apollo
